cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.SD, cs.LG, cs.IR. 

The paper discusses natural language question-answering interfaces to enterprise systems, which falls under the category of natural language processing (NLP). The paper specifically focuses on adapting general-purpose speech recognition engines for domain-specific NLP, which suggests that it may belong to the sub-category of computational linguistics (cs.CL). The paper also mentions the use of machine learning, which is a common technique in artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Additionally, the paper discusses the recognition of domain-specific words, which could fall under the sub-category of software engineering (cs.SD). The paper also mentions the use of evolutionary development, which could fall under the sub-category of machine learning (cs.LG). Finally, the paper discusses natural language question-answering, which could fall under the sub-category of information retrieval (cs.IR).
